analytic.title: Restoration of a Lacuna in One of the Greek Versions of the Apocryphal Acts of Thomas (BHG 1801-803), ms. Paris Coisl. 121, fols. 9r-10v

monogr.title: Lost and Bound: Reconstruction Techniques in Fragmentary Manuscripts of the Jewish and Christians Traditions

biblStruct.note: The manuscript belongs to the Γ family of the text, but was unknown to M. Bonnet. We propose a reconstruction of the parts damaged by comparison with other textual witnesses containing a similar recension of the Greek texts of these Apocryphon.

body.bibl: Muñoz Gallarte, Israel, and Ángel Narro. “Restoration of a Lacuna in One of the Greek Versions of the Apocryphal Acts of Thomas (BHG 1801-803), Ms. Paris Coisl. 121, Fols. 9r-10v.” In Lost and Bound: Reconstruction Techniques in Fragmentary Manuscripts of the Jewish and Christians Traditions, edited by Israel Muñoz Gallarte and Marzena Zawanowska, 73–91. Aramaeo-Arabica et Graeca 5. Madrid: Sindéresis, 2022.

Israel Muñoz Gallarte and Ángel Narro, Restoration of a Lacuna in One of the Greek Versions of the Apocryphal Acts of Thomas (BHG 1801-803), Ms. Paris Coisl. 121, Fols. 9r-10v,” in Lost and Bound: Reconstruction Techniques in Fragmentary Manuscripts of the Jewish and Christians Traditions, ed. Israel Muñoz Gallarte and Marzena Zawanowska, Aramaeo-Arabica et Graeca 5 (Madrid: Sindéresis, 2022), 73–91.
